tn.text: This is the name of a man. Translate this name in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:26:28|26:29]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh commanded you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a man. Translate this name in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:26:33|26:33]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: will be removed from our ancestor's share
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "will no longer belong to our ancestor's share" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "It will belong to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: it will be removed from the assigned share of our inheritance
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "it will no longer be a part of our inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the year of Jubilee of the people
tn.text: This refers to a celebration which happens once every fifty years. In this celebration, all land that someone sold or traded must return to the original owner. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "their share will belong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: their share will be taken away from the share of our ancestors' tribe
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they will take our tribe's share of the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Let them be married to whom they think best
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Let them marry whom they want" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: but they must be married only within their father's tribe
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but they may only marry someone from their father's tribe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "share" represents the portion of land that each tribe received as an inheritance. AT: "No portion of the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: who owns a share in her tribe
tn.text: "who owns a share of land in her tribe"
The land that each clan possesses is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they received. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: No share may change hands from one tribe to another
tn.text: Transferring ownership from one tribe to another is spoken of as if the property passed from one person's hands to another person's hands. AT: "No one may transfer the ownership of any share of land from one tribe to another" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah
tn.text: These are names of women. Translate these names in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:26:33|26:33]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

The land that each of Zelophehad's daughters possessed is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they received. AT: "the lands that they received as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
a large area of flat land
